info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 12:15PM CDT until May 30 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Chambers, Harris and Liberty.
* WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1215 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Baytown, Jacinto City, Barrett, Highlands, Channelview, Cloverleaf, Crosby, Mont Belvieu, Old River- Winfree, Cove, Sheldon, Lake Houston Dam, Lake Houston, northern Houston Ship Channel, Hunterwood, Northshore, El Dorado / Oates Prairie, East Houston, Settegast and Pleasantville Area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Chambers, TX; Harris, TX; Liberty, TX
